clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical Efficacy and Safety of Tacrolimus in Refractory Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients for 6 Months Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Clinical Study to Observe the Efficacy and Safety of Tacrolimus in Refractory Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients for 6 Months Treatment in China

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to observed prospectively the efficacy and safety of 6 months treatment of Tacrolimus alone or with methotrexate (MTX) in moderate and severe Chinese RA patients who shown insufficiency response or intolerance to DMARDs

detailed_description.textblock: This study will enroll 100 cases of refractory rheumatoid arthritis (RA) patients in Chinese，who are in moderate or severe disease activity and insufficiency response or intolerance to DMARDs. The participants plan to be treated with Tacrolimus alone, or along with methotrexate (MTX) if participants were tolerant to MTX. The efficacy and safety of 6 month Tacrolimus treatment in RA patients will be evaluated with DAS28 and other disease activity indices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline swollen joint number (SW28) at 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline swollen joint number (SW28) at 24 weeks. SW28 means the number of joints with swelling counted in 28 synovial joints, including proximal interphalangeal joints (10 joints), metacarpophalangeal joints (10), wrists (2), elbows (2), shoulders (2) and knees (2) bilateral.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline tenderness joint number (T28) at 24 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline tenderness joint number (T28) at 24 weeks. T28 means the number of joints with tenderness upon touching counted in 28 synovial joints, including proximal interphalangeal joints (10 joints), metacarpophalangeal joints (10), wrists (2), elbows (2), shoulders (2) and knees (2) bilateral.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) at 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) at 24 weeks

arm_group.description: RA patients treated with tacrolimus, without MTX
RA patients treated with tacrolimus and MTX

intervention.description: Tacrolimus capsule: 0.5mg to 1mg, po, twice per day (Bid) until the endpoint or unacceptable toxicity develops.
MTX： 7.5mg to 15mg, po, once per week (Qw) until the endpoint or unacceptable toxicity develops.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data for all primary and secondary outcome measures will be made available within 12 months of study completion.
